exercise.question: Question 1: Wonder, drawing, stares, Gran, puppy
exercise.answer:
1) Wonder: to have a wish to know something 
Example sentences:
 1) I wonder how would my result be.
2) I was looking at my sister with wonder.
 2) Drawing: making a picture with a pencil or a pen 
Example sentences: 
1) I made a very colourful drawing.
2) Her drawing was very beautiful. 
3) Stares: To look at someone for a long time 
Example sentences: 
1) My father stares at me when I do not complete my homework. 
2) She gave me a cold stare
4) Gran: grandmother 
Example sentences:
 1) My gran makes delicious food. 
2) Gran always loves her grandchildren.
5) Puppy: a young dog 
Example sentences:
 1) My puppy‘s name is Smurfy.
 2) Robinson was a very cheerful puppy.

exercise.question:
Find a partner. Let your partner pretend to be the teacher who welcomed you to your class.
 • Now act out your first day at school.
exercise.answer:
Teacher: Good Morning! Rahul. How are you? 
Student: Good Morning Ma’am. I am good.
Teacher: It’s very nice to have you in the class. Please be seated.
 Student: Thank you ma’am. 
Teacher: Rahul, please introduce yourself to everyone in the class.
 Student: Hi, My name is Rahul. I am from Mumbai. I stay with my grandparents here. I like to watch cricket.

exercise.question: Giraffe, surprised, adventure, wonderful, playground
exercise.answer:
1) Giraffe: a tall mammal with a very long neck and forelegs
Example sentences: 
1) Harish saw a giraffe in the zoo.
2) The giraffe eats leaves.
2) Surprised: amazed
Example sentences:
1) I was surprised to see my mother at the airport.
2) She was surprised to see her birthday gift.
3) Adventure: an exciting and daring experience 
Example sentences:
 1) I have to share my adventure experience with Reema.
 2) My first day in school was an adventure for me. 
4) Wonderful: extremely good
 Example sentences:
 1) Eating ice-cream is winters is wonderful. 
2) We all had a wonderful weekend.
5) Playground: an outdoor area for children to play
Example sentences:
1) I play football with my friends in the playground.
2) Ravi was shouting in the playground with his friends.

exercise.question:
• Act out the story. Play the parts of the monkey, the wise woman and the mother, in turns in the classroom. 
• What would you do if you had a magic wand? I would turn it round and round and turn a book into a _________________. I would turn a dog into a _________________. I would turn a pencil into a _________________. I would turn you into a _________________.
exercise.answer:
Disclaimer: These are sample answers. Students are advised to write the answers based on their own experience and observation. 
• Monkey: I look so simple. I wish I could look like a giraffe. 
• Wise Woman: If that is you wish, let me give you a magic wand that will fulfil any of your wish. 
• Monkey: Oh wow! You are so kind. Thank you very much. Magic wand! Turn me into a giraffe. whizzzz! 
• Wise Woman: Your wish has been granted. You now look so tall. 
• Monkey: Let me see myself in the mirror. Oh No! My neck and tail does not match with each other. I look so ugly. It is very uncomfortable for me to walk with this long neck. 
• Mother: Son! I already told you that you are unique in your own self. 
• Monkey: I should have listened to you. Magic wand! Please turn me back into a monkey. 
• Wise Woman: You are back again. You look so wonderful! 
• If I had a magic wand, I would turn myself into a Superman and help all the people in their tough time. I would fly to any part of the world and help them solve their problems. 
 I would turn it round and round and turn a book into a pizza. I would turn a dog into a puppy. I would turn a pencil into a music system. I would turn you into a fairy.

exercise.question: Road, Coat, Quickly, Stronger, Cheeks, Won
exercise.answer:
1) Road: an open way for travel or transportation 
Example sentences: 
1) We took the country road to meet our relatives. 
2) There was a traffic jam on the road. 
2) Coat: an outer garment with sleeves to make you feel warm 
Example sentences: 
1) I will be wearing coat at the party tonight. 
2) She gifted me a black coat on my birthday, 
3) Quickly: at a fast speed 
Example sentences: 
1) We walked quickly to catch the train. 
2) The dog ran quickly to catch the cat. 
4) Stronger: more powerful 
Example sentences: 
1) Rohan is stronger than Smith. 
2) The sun was stronger than the wind. 
5) Cheeks: either side of the face below the eye 
Example sentences: 
1) Her cheeks are pink in colour. 
2) My cheeks get red during winters. 
6) Won: to be successful or victory 
Example sentences: 
1) Our team won the football match. 
2) Saima won the championship trophy this year.

exercise.question:
• What did the wind do to get the man’s coat off? 
• What did the sun do to get the man’s coat off? 
• Who won in the end? 
• Who said this to whom – “I can get his coat off more quickly than you can.” “I will let you try first.” “How cold it is!” “I give up. I cannot get his coat off!” “I have won.”
exercise.answer:
• The wind blew hard to get the man’s coat off. 
• The sun started shining hard to get the man’s coat off. 
• The sun won in the end. 
• “I can get his coat off more quickly than you can.”- The Wind said to the Sun. 
• “I will let you try first.”- The Sun said to the Wind. 
• “How cold it is!”- The man to himself. 
• “I give up. I cannot get his coat off!”- The Wind to the Sun. 
• “I have won.”- The Sun to the Wind.

exercise.question:
• Complete the story As One little white cloud floated in the sky one day. Another little cloud called out. “Come, let us play!”
As Two little clouds danced in the sky so blue, Another little cloud asked, “Can I
join you?”
As Three little clouds held hands in the sky, The wind blew another little cloud
very close by.
As Four little clouds decided what to do, Another little cloud joined them very
quietly too!
• Now write what the fifth and the sixth clouds did.
exercise.answer:
As One little white cloud floated in the sky one day. Another little cloud
called out. “Come, let us play!”
As Two little clouds danced in the sky so blue, Another little cloud asked, “Can I
join you?”
As Three little clouds held hands in the sky, The wind blew another little cloud
very close by.
As Four little clouds decided what to do, Another little cloud joined them very
quietly too!
As Five little clouds went to bloom, Another big cloud started to bloom!
As six clouds started walking along a chain, One tiny cloud asked them to dance
along in the rain.

exercise.question: snail, dark, feelers, storm, lightning, thunder
exercise.answer:
1) Snail: a small animal with a round shell 
Example sentences: 
1) Snails crawl very slowly. 
2) Snails have a spiral shell to cover their body.
2) Dark: with little or no light 
Example sentences: 
1) We were having our dinner in a dark room as there was no electricity. 
2) I saw a monster in a forest on a dark night.
3) Feelers: an animal organ that is used for testing things by touch 
Example sentences: 
1) Snail uses its feelers to know which food to eat. 
2) Ants have tiny feelers to reach towards their food.
4) Storm: a violent weather with strong winds 
Example sentences: 
1)The storm took away the umbrella I was carrying. 
2) The kids got scared with the sound of the storm.
5) Lightning: bright flash with thunder 
Example sentences: 
1) Our car got stuck because of lightning. 
2) There was a terrible flash of lightning on my birthday.
6) Thunder: crashing noise after lightning 
Example sentences: 
1) It began to thunder after we reached the school. 
2) The river thundered below.

exercise.question: Look at the pictures. Narrate the story in your language and then in English.
exercise.answer:
Disclaimer: This is a sample story provided to you. Students are advised to write the story using their own imaginative and creative skills. 
One day three rabbits were playing with each other on a sunny day. Their names were Rabbu, Reeyas and Ruby. Ruby found a carrot from the forest and asked Reeyas if he also wanted to have the carrot. Suddenly, a tiger came from behind the tree and started howling loudly. All the three rabbits got terribly frightened and ran towards the pond. 
They saw their best friend Gumpu, the elephant coming from the pond. Seeing the tiger chasing the rabbits, Gumpu asked them to cross the pond on his nose. The three rabbits quickly jumped on Gumpu’s nose and crossed the pond. The tiger got very angry looking at this. 
Gumpu then stored a lot of water in its mouth and raised its trunk to throw the water on the tiger’s face. The water got splashed on the tiger’s face. Gumpu and rabbits laughed loudly looking at the tiger’s terrible condition.

exercise.question: Pretend that you are Curlylocks. Tell your friends what happened to you when you went into the bears’ cottage. You can tell the story first in your own language and then in English. Begin like this – I am curlylocks. I have curly hair. One day I …
exercise.answer:
Disclaimer: This is one sample story given to you. Students are expected to write the answer using their own creative and imaginative skills. 
I have curly locks. I have curly hair. One day I decided to roam around the forest near my cottage. After a few steps, I saw a beautiful and small cottage. I was very happy to see that. I went inside the cottage and saw nobody there. I was very surprised and also scared to see that there was no one in the house. I went into the kitchen and saw three bowls of porridge. I was very hungry, so I tasted from all the bowls but I liked the porridge only from the tiny bowl as it was just fine for me to eat. I was feeling very tired, so I thought about taking a rest for a while. I found three beds in the bedroom. I tried to fit in all the three beds but it was only the tiny bed where I felt comfortable. I took a nap and then after half an hour, I saw three bears in front of me. They all were staring at me. I got goosebumps looking at them. I thought of nothing thereafter and just ran off from the place. It was a very adventurous experience for me. I enjoyed it and would love to visit the place again.

exercise.question: Order, rub, puzzle, erase, court
exercise.answer:
1) Order: a command 
Example sentences: 
1) My class teacher ordered me to leave the classroom. 
2) I ordered the waiter to get a pizza for me. 
2) Rub: to move to and fro against each other 
Example sentences: 
1) I rubbed my hand against the wall. 
2) Write the answers with pencil so that you can rub it with an eraser. 
3) Puzzle: confused 
Example sentences: 
1) I was puzzled by the magician’s magic. 
2) This poem has always been a puzzle for me. 
4) Erase: to rub or remove 
Example sentences: 
1) My brother erased all the answers I wrote. 
2) Its difficult to erase precious memories. 
5) Court: a body of people with a judge to solve civil and criminal cases 
Example sentences: 
1) The court will be closed this Monday. 
2) It is not easy to deal with court cases.

exercise.question: Fill in the blanks with a, an or the Once there was __________ beautiful garden. __________ garden had __________ apple tree, __________ orange tree and __________ guava tree. x In __________ garden lived __________ big giant. __________ giant did not like children to play in _________ garden. __________ giant used to eat __________ fruit every day from __________ garden. But he did not share these with __________ children. So his garden dried up.
exercise.answer: Once there was a beautiful garden. The garden had an apple tree, an orange tree and a guava tree. In the garden lived a big giant. The giant did not like children to play in the garden. The giant used to eat a fruit every day from the garden. But he did not share these with the children. So his garden dried up.

Once there was a beautiful garden. The garden had an apple tree, an orange tree and a guava tree. In the garden lived a big giant. The giant did not like children to play in the garden. The giant used to eat a fruit every day from the garden. But he did not share these with the children. So his garden dried up.

exercise.question:
Ask your mother or an older person to help you. You need – Milk, porridge, sugar 1. Take hot milk. 
2. Add cooked porridge. 
3. Add sugar and eat it. Repeat this recipe in your language to the class.
exercise.answer:
Disclaimer: This is a creative activity to be done with your mother at home. This will teach you how to cook porridge. 
Disclaimer: This is a sample answer. Students are advised to write the answer based on their own experiences and observations. 
One day, I forgot to bring my lunch box in school. I had not taken my breakfast either. When the bell rang for interval, everyone rushed outside the classroom to have their lunch. None of them asked me for lunch. It was only my best friend named Karan who came to my seat with his lunch. He happily shared his lunch with me. That’s why we say:” A friend in need is a friend in deed”.
